svg.text: ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ VARIANT DESIGN PRINCIPLES │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ │ │ 1. ISOLATION │ │ └─▶ Treatment differs in ONE thing from control │ │ └─▶ Enables clear causal attribution │ │ │ │ 2. MINIMAL VIABLE CHANGE │ │ └─▶ Test the smallest change that tests hypothesis │ │ └─▶ Easier to interpret results │ │ │ │ 3. CONSISTENCY │ │ └─▶ Users always see same variant (sticky assignment) │ │ └─▶ Prevents confusion and metric pollution │ │ │ │ 4. MEASURABILITY │ │ └─▶ Change must be detectable in metrics │ │ └─▶ Backend-only changes need proxy metrics │ │ │ │ 5. REVERSIBILITY │ │ └─▶ Must be able to quickly rollback │ │ └─▶ Feature flags for instant control │ │ │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
